name: ContentRepurposeAI
description: An AI‑powered service that ingests blog posts (via URL or raw text) and automatically creates multiple repurposed assets – a newsletter, social‑media snippets, and slide decks – while preserving the core message and brand tone.

tools.name: fetch_blog_content
tools.description: Retrieves the full HTML content of a public blog post given its URL and extracts the main article text and title.

url.description: The absolute URL of the blog post to fetch.

tools.name: summarize_text
tools.description: Creates a concise, bullet‑point summary of a long piece of text, optionally limiting the number of bullet points.

text.description: The full text to be summarized.

max_points.description: Maximum number of bullet points to return. If omitted, defaults to 7.

tools.name: generate_newsletter
tools.description: Formats a newsletter in Markdown using the article title, a short intro, the summary, and optionally the full article body.

title.description: The title of the original article.

summary.description: A concise bullet‑point summary of the article.

full_text.description: Optional full article text to embed at the bottom of the newsletter.

tools.name: generate_social_snippets
tools.description: Produces a list of short, platform‑appropriate social‑media snippets (e.g., tweets, LinkedIn posts) based on the article summary.

platforms.description: List of platforms to tailor the snippets for. If omitted, all are generated.

count_per_platform.description: How many snippets to generate per platform (default 3).

tools.name: generate_slide_deck
tools.description: Creates a simple slide‑deck JSON structure (title, bullet points per slide) from a list of key points.

key_points.description: Ordered list of main ideas to become individual slides.

max_slides.description: Maximum number of slides to generate (default 7).

examples.description: User provides a blog URL and asks for a newsletter plus three tweet‑sized snippets.

# Remote Work Trends 2024

Hey team, here’s what’s shaping remote work this year.

- **Hybrid work is becoming the norm** – most companies now offer split office/home schedules.
- **Productivity metrics have improved** – measured outputs are up 15% on average.
- **Home‑office stipends** are trending, with 68% of firms adding a budget for equipment.
- **Asynchronous communication** reduces meeting fatigue and gives flexibility.
- **Global talent pools** allow hiring without geographic limits.

*Read the full article for deeper insights.*
